Overall, Cyrus has undoubtedly made a positive and notable effort in his academic and social development, and we are proud of his progress.

write in 200 words with positive and professional language a focus child report of Yiyi, 5 year old girl, basing on the following photos: 1. Yiyi is focused in animal rescue activity where she looked for injured animals and brought them back to the animal hospital to rescue. She used different medical equipment and took very good care of the soft toy animal. this shows her empathy and care towards animals; 2. She was helping her friend to look for animal photos in the jungle animal scavenger hunt activity. this shows she is willing to help her peers; 3. Yiyi is making a Mother's Day card with strips of coloured paper and stickers. She loves mom and wanted to make a beautiful card for mom. this shows her creativity. 4. Her fine motor skills are good, which we can see from My Own Jungle activity where she worked with a friend to cut and paste their own jungle photo. 5. Her phonics has improved a lot. She likes phonics activities and can be focused for a long time. She remembers and recognised the letters and sounds. She's also learning tricky words.

Yiyi, our 5-year-old student, has been making significant progress in various developmental areas lately. During the animal rescue activity, she showed tremendous empathy and care towards injured animals. She used different medical equipment with ease and took excellent care of the soft toy animal. Yiyi's level of concern and focus during this activity is an excellent example of her outstanding empathy and sensitivity.

Yiyi has been making great strides in her social development as well, as demonstrated by her willingness to help peers during the jungle animal scavenger hunt. Her caring and cooperative nature were apparent during this activity, and she was happy to lend a helping hand when required.

Furthermore, Yiyi exhibited exemplary creativity while making a Mother's Day card using strips of colored paper and stickers. She poured her heart into making a beautiful card for her mom, demonstrating exceptional artistic talent and attention to detail.

Yiyi's fine motor skills are excellent, as shown in the "My Own Jungle" activity, where she worked with a friend to cut and paste their own jungle photo. She has fine-tuned her manual dexterity, and her attention to detail has helped her make great strides in this area.

Finally, Yiyi's phonics has improved significantly, and she is now able to recognise both letters and sounds, along with learning tricky words as well. She enjoys phonics activities and can remain focused for long durations.

Overall, Yiyi has demonstrated remarkable progress in her academic and social development. Her hard work and dedication are admirable, and we are looking forward to seeing her continue to thrive and achieve her full potential.

write in 200 words in positive and professional language a focus child report of Mikin, 5 year old boy, who is a new K2 child to the class. Base the report on the following photos: 1. Mikin tried his best when doing the cut-and-paste activity of making his own safari map. He needs more practice in scissor skills and pasting; 2. Mikin enjoyed making a medal for Gerald the Giraffe in the story Giraffes Can't Dance. He decorated with coloured pens and stickers. He was proud of his work. 3. Mikin enjoys construction toys in the classroom. his recent favourite is the magnetic pieces. He has used them to build many different structures, displaying his creativity and constructing skills; 4. Mikin has made many friends despite being a new member of the class. This shows he has good social skills. 5. Mikin has been trying his best to learn phonics sounds and writing letters. with more practice, he'll make even more progress.

Mikin is a new K2 student in our class, and we have been pleased to see him grow and develop in various ways in recent weeks. During the cut-and-paste activity of making his own safari map, he tried his best and exhibited a good attitude towards learning. Although he requires more practice with his scissor skills and pasting, his willingness to learn is admirable.

Mikin displayed excellent creativity and artistic skills while making a medal for Gerald the Giraffe in the story "Giraffes Can't Dance". He used coloured pens and stickers to decorate the medal and felt proud of his work. His attention to detail is incredible, and he has an eye for detail and aesthetics that many children his age lack.

In the classroom, Mikin has exhibited excellent construction skills while enjoying construction toys. His favorite toy is the magnetic pieces, which he uses to build many different structures, demonstrating his creativity and imagination.

Mikin has made many friends despite being a new member of the class, showing excellent social skills. He has demonstrated an outgoing personality and a positive attitude towards his peers, making him a valuable asset to our classroom community.

Finally, Mikin has been trying his best to improve his phonics sounds and writing letters. With more practice, he will undoubtedly make even more progress. We are impressed with his eagerness to learn and the effort he puts into his work.

Overall, Mikin has shown remarkable potential and significant progress since joining our class. We are proud of him and excited to see what the future holds for him.
